explanation: The report is correct. UtAssert_GenericIntegerCompare calls strncmp(ActualText, UTASSERT_PREFIX, sizeof(UTASSERT_PREFIX) - 1) and the same for RefText without any prior NULL or length validation. strncmp will read up to n bytes (here n = sizeof(UTASSERT_PREFIX)-1 = 9) from the pointer arguments unless it encounters a '\0' earlier. If ActualText or RefText is NULL, or if the object they point to is shorter than n bytes and not NUL-terminated within those n bytes, the call can read beyond the bounds of the referenced object (or dereference NULL), producing undefined behaviour. That directly conflicts with MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17, which forbids uses of <string.h> functions that may access beyond object bounds.
